page.title: 10Housing
page.content: New Costessey is mainly residential, with a very individual mixture of detached older-style bungalows, and more modern bungalows, chalets and houses, owner-occupied. There are two major areas of council housing: postwar terraced and semidetached houses to the northwest of the A47, and a very new mixed area to the North of this, replacing postwar 'prefabs'. In Old Costessey, there is one council development of the 1970s, but the main type of newish housing is 'up-market' family houses, in small individual developments. Of course, the highly individual housing of the original village remains.
